meanings.definition: A small, narrow boat propelled by oars.
meanings.sent1: The rowboat gently glided across the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: We rented a rowboat to explore the peaceful river.
meanings.sent3: The rowboat and the canoe had a race to see which was faster.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of grass, the rowboat was a lone explorer.
meanings.sent5: The rowboat bobbed up and down with each stroke of the oars.

meanings.definition: To propel a rowboat using oars.
meanings.sent1: She rowboat-ed gracefully through the water.
meanings.sent2: We rowboat to the island every summer.
meanings.sent3: He rowboat-ed so fast, he left ripples in his wake.
meanings.sent4: Rowboat-ing against the current felt like a never-ending battle.
meanings.sent5: The team rowboat-ed together in perfect harmony.
